name: MediConnect
description: Patients struggled to find specialists and book appointments, resulting in high drop-off rates and missed care opportunities.

context.description: A telehealth platform connecting elderly patients with specialists.
context.usage: Mobile app for patients, tablet/web for doctors.

problem.statement: High booking abandonment rate due to complex UI.
problem.core: 40% of users dropped off at the 'Insurance Verification' step.

goals.success: Reduced support calls regarding 'how to book' by 50%.

decisions.title: Voice Assistant Integration
decisions.desc: Added voice search to help users with limited dexterity.

decisions.title: Simplified Stepper
decisions.desc: Broke the booking process into single-question screens.

uxFlow.primary: Search Specialty -> Select Doctor -> Confirm Slot -> Payment.

solution.title: Booking Flow
solution.caption: Large touch targets and high contrast for accessibility.

system.structure: Component library focused on inputs and navigation.

outcome.quote: "My grandmother can finally book her own appointments."

learnings: Testing with the actual demographic (65+) revealed issues we never guessed.
Trust signals are crucial in healthcare apps.
